availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John H. Ward (Green County, Kentucky, resident and soldier)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, resident and soldier. Green County, Kentucky, native. Son of William T. Ward and Sarah T. Ward. Resident of Green County, Kentucky, in 1850. Served in the 27th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry as lieutenant colonel from March 21, 1862, to to March 29, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 1, p. 118A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 8, p. 122B.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0389.
"Organization of the Twenty-Seventh Kentucky Regiment," Louisville Daily Journal (Louisville, KY), January 23, 1862, p. 3.
"A Striking Resemblance," Lincoln County News (Lincolnton, NC), March 13, 1908, p. 1.
"John Hardin Ward Sr. (1835-1908)," Find A Grave, Memorial 168628619, accessed September 2, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/168628619.
